required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Unidirectional Barbed Sutures in Mucogingival Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Unidirectional Barbed Sutures on Various Outcomes in Mucogingival Procedures

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare the efficacy of barbed suture with conventional suture in muco-gingival surgeries.

detailed_description.textblock:
Experimental: Main treatment group, flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with barbed sutures.
Comparator: In patients allocated to control group, flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with conventional sutures.

primary_outcome.description: Primary wound closure and early wound healing by EHS at 7days,14days,21days

secondary_outcome.description: Pain by Visual Analogous Scale immediately

arm_group.arm_group_label: Flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with barbed sutures
arm_group.description: After administration of adequate amount of local anesthesia, planned muco-gingival surgery will be performed and flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with unidirectional barbed sutures.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with conventional sutures
arm_group.description: After administration of adequate amount of local anesthesia, planned muco-gingival surgery will be performed and flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with conventional sutures.

intervention.description: Experimental: Wound will be closed using unidirectional barbed sutures in muco-gingival surgeries Active Comparator: Wound will be closed using conventional sutures in muco-gingival surgeries
intervention.arm_group_label: Flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with barbed sutures
Flap will be approximated using conventional, simple continuous suturing with conventional sutures

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Systemically healthy individuals within an age group of 20-50yrs with presence of attached gingiva, shallow vestibule and frenum interfering with the marginal gingiva.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medically compromised patients.
- Subjects who underwent radiotherapy or chemotherapy in the past 12 months.
- Smokers

facility.name: SVS Institute of Dental Sciences, Mahabubnagar
